title: 114_hr5541
content: The Act titled "Financial Services for the Underserved Act of 2016" includes amendments related to credit union service in underserved areas. The Act "Financial Services for the Underserved Act of 2016" amends the Federal Credit Union Act to allow credit unions to include individuals or organizations in underserved areas as members. The Act "Financial Services for the Underserved Act of 2016" allows credit unions to include underserved areas as members if they are well capitalized and provide services in the local community within 24 months of approval. Any failure of a Federal credit union to meet the requirement within 24 months will terminate approval of their application. Approved credit unions must submit an annual report on membership and local facilities. The Board considers the credit union's presence in the local community when approving applications. The Administration publishes an annual report listing approved applications, underserved areas considered, and the total number of new credit union members. The Federal Credit Union Act is amended to define "underserved area" as a geographic area meeting criteria for a low-income community or underserved based on data from the Board and Federal banking agencies. Section 109(e)(2) of the Act is amended to include specific provisions regarding Federal credit unions operating within approved geographic areas. The Union Act (12 U.S.C. 1759(e)(2)) is amended to include specific provisions for Federal credit unions operating in approved geographic areas.
